dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but seriously, how many times does Tesla have to, like, mess up before people just stop trusting them?

dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, I know! Seven Walmart stores, right? Seven fires!

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musk Walmart claims that Tesla installed faulty solar panels that eventually spontaneously combusted and caught fire at seven Walmart stores around the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! From their solar panels! Can you even believe it? Spontaneous combustion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! From their solar panels! Can you even believe it? Spontaneous combustion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musk Walmart claims that Tesla installed faulty solar panels that eventually spontaneously combusted and caught fire at seven Walmart stores around the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Spontaneous combustion! And, uh, apparently, like, wrong wiring, substandard hardware.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Spontaneous combustion! And, uh, apparently, like, wrong wiring, substandard hardware.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The lawsuit alleges that Tesla inspectors didnt notice defects that were visible to the naked eye, used cable connectors that werent compatible with one another and failed to see that loose and hanging wires were present at multiple sites.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. And Walmart's saying it's all because Tesla was, you know, just going too fast with their expansion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. And Walmart's saying it's all because Tesla was, you know, just going too fast with their expansion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Walmart says in the lawsuit it believes the failures were the result of rushed installation because Teslas solar division adopted an ill-considered business model that required it to install solar panel systems haphazardly and as quickly as possible in order to turn a profit...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Speed over quality, always! And they knew about it, right? Internal documents show they knew since 2017.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Speed over quality, always! And they knew about it, right? Internal documents show they knew since twenty seventeen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right! After the SolarCity acquisition. Pushing those aggressive installation quotas.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right! After the SolarCity acquisition. Pushing those aggressive installation quotas.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla got into the solar business after it acquired SolarCity in 2016 for $2.6 billion. ... Walmart says in the lawsuit it believes the failures were the result of rushed installation because Teslas solar division adopted an ill-considered business model that required it to install solar panel systems haphazardly and as quickly as possible in order to turn a profit...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Inexperienced contractors, like, no proper training. It's just a disaster waiting to happen.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Inexperienced contractors, like, no proper training. It's just a disaster waiting to happen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the contractors and subcontractors who performed the original installation work had not been properly hired, trained, and supervised.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And Walmart's pointing to the structural damage, the store closures, the financial losses. It's huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Walmart's pointing to the structural damage, the store closures, the financial losses. It's huge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, seriously, what are they even doing? This new rental plan they just announced? Who's gonna trust that?
